ratings.comment: Professor Canon is the best professor I''ve ever had. He is so passionate about what he teaches and truly goes above & beyond to engage with students. His classes are fairly difficult but are so worth it because you learn a lot & Canon works to ensure students have the opportunity to succeed. I am incredibly sad to hear Professor Canon is retiring.

Dr. Canon is the nicest guy. You can tell he absolutely loves what he does. His lectures are clear and he adds in good stories from time to time. He encourages questions and is very responsive. I am sad he is retiring, he is the sweetest little old man.

Professor Canon is the best poli sci professor I've ever had! He is passionate about what he teaches and his lectures are very informative. He offers study guides that definitely prepare you for the exams and if you do them, study, and read all of the readings you will get an A.

I loved having Professor Canon so much. His lectures are great, and he definitely values education rather than research or grades. This class takes some work, but it's not necessarily difficult. The exams are easy to prepare for, as he gives you a list of everything that could be on them. I would for sure recommend this class with Dr. Canon!
Sometimes the readings seemed excessive, but overall, was a super interesting and well-structured course.

Grade is based off 2 midterms, a final, and discussion section. Canon provides study sheets for every exam which are very useful. Exam content is fair, equally based off of reading & lecture content. This class is hard for being elementary level, leans more intermediate level. Do not take just for social science breadth- there are easier ones

Professor Canon is truly an amazing guy. He is very knowledgeable, and it is clear that he has a passion for government and teaching. The class is graded off of 2 Midterms, the Final, and Discussion Section which can make it challenging, however, if you put in the work and keep up with the notes you'll be fine.

Good man. Canon is a knowledgable guy. The class is graded on the two midterms, a final exam, and discussion participation. That's it. Which is a bit lame, but the class is still solid. I will say, it's a little annoying that it was just another old white man talking about what our government should and shouldn't do, but he does a good job.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Canon is the most unhelpful professor ever. Even if you attend every lecture, take notes, and go to discussion, you will barely make it. His midterms and final are graded so heavily, I barely passed.
Terrible.

Canon is AWESOME! In the race and politics FIG seminar he leads, his passion for his work is so clear and he knows everything about the stuff he teaches. He is great at leading round-table discussions and will entertain any idea even if he doesn't personally agree. Tons and tons of reading, but most of it is pretty interesting. Great guy

Prof Canon is very passionate about election studies and wrote the book for 104 (literally it is his book). There is not much opportunities for online substitutions if you can't attend a class and it is a big time commitment. You will need to put effort and time into readings and studies to get a good grade.

Canon is super knowledgable, engaging, and just a nice guy. Workload is pretty excessive -- about 60 pages a week (textbook is optional, but supplemental readings aren't). He's a good prof if you really want to learn, but there are easier 104 professors. Regardless, I really enjoyed his class. Only thing is he didn't post lectures online.

Professor Canon is a great professor who is so nice despite being a very accomplished political scientist. His seminar opened my eyes to many injustices in America and I think he did a great job managing this class. I would recommend him to any political science student because he is very knowledgable and understanding.

For an intro class, it was very difficult. During the week the homework is a INquiz which is basically a guaranteed A, but there is so much reading and it's very dense. The final and midterm were so hard and time consuming because the lectures cover so much material. I spent hours going over notes trying to pick out material to write about.

As far as professors go, Professor Canon is a pretty good choice. He's likable and a fine lecturer, if not particularly engaging. You definitely need to do the reading, but if you do and pay attention in lecture/discussion, you should do just fine on the tests. He definitely cares that his students leave as more informed and participatory citizens.

Professor Canon is super sweet and knows exactly what he's talking about. Main thing for me was the fact that your grade is based heavily on 3 exams (2 midterms and final). The discussion 10% doesn't do much for your grade. Grade cutouts are nice though!

Amazing and knowledgeable professor. This class is very interesting, and you learn a lot. Only take it if you are passionate about the topic because it is a lot of work and requires effort. If you read the textbooks and go to lectures, the midterms will be fair. The final is difficult but graded nicely overall. Great class, but heavy.

Professor Canon was a great teacher and very passionate about this subject. He is good at explaining topics and nice to students, willing to help them out during office hours, however, the actual content of the class made this the hardest class for me. It is so dense and theres so much to cover, I love this professor but the class is impossible.
Professor Canon is a great teacher who is always willing to help his students

You can tell Prof Canon cares a lot about all of the topics he discusses. He is very good at explaining things in a clear and concise way and I loved going to his lectures. He is always available to answer questions and his exams were very fair. Prof Canon is awesome, you know he is truly passionate about his class and what he is teaching.

David Cannon is very passionate about his subject and it shows in lecture. The tests are very fair I would say, not trick questions but just very dense. I wouldn't take this class if you just need a humanities credit because it is in no means an easy A and there are much easier humanities credits. I love the professor but is my lowest grade.

Lectures can be a bit boring, but for an intro level course like this, he really covered as much as he could in a semester without being overwhelming. I could tell in every lecture that he really cared that the students understood what he was saying. The tests are kind of annoying in their format and because of how impactful they were on our grade.

I love Prof. Canon. Super interesting guy who I talked with a couple times in office hours. 104 is very reading intensive but he goes over all the reading in class. Wouldn't skip lectures, however, he does add onto several things require for the final.

Professor Canon is a very interesting and respectable lecturer and professor. He truly wants you to succeed in his class and offers many opportunities to do well. It is reading heavy but it's a manageable workload.

This was a Socratic seminar style class, and despite being a very highly-accredited political scientist, Prof. Canon was so, so nice. He was very receptive to ideas and you can tell he knows so much. The grading criteria is a little unclear at some points, however. He didn't really lecture in this style of class, but I can imagine he would be great

Prof. Canon is a very respected professor in American politics and is a great prof for the intro class. I would highly recommend taking Canon. During online, our exams were in essay form rather than the normal in-person tests. I thought the essays took much longer and were graded on somewhat unclear criteria but that is my only complaint.

Professor Canon is such an amazing person. I had a problem getting my textbook shipped overseas and he was able to find a solution for me. He is just so nice and caring. He is very knowledgeable and respected in his field. He wrote the textbook we used too so his lectures were easy to follow through. This class was tough but the prof was worth it!

In regards to teaching Professor Canon is an amazing lecturer. You can tell he is very passionate about the material and his content is easy to understand. However, his essay tests are extreme and require a lot of time. The final is 3000+ words. Even my 500+ level courses have not expected me to write so much, especially during a pandemic.

Dr. Canon is brilliant & wrote the textbook used for class. I went to every lecture but I only used the textbook for exams. During the week there is not much work, only TED readings and InQuiz quizzes which are basically a guaranteed A. I found the 2 midterm exams to be extremely with 4 essays each & final with 5 & spent hrs on writing them
Extremely sweet and understanding. Explains concepts well and replies to emails on time. Willing to help and designed coursework well.

This class was structured very well and if you attend all lectures and discussions you will learn a lot. The exams were all essays and they were very time-consuming and required a lot of applied thinking. The homework assignments are basically a guaranteed A. Would recommend if you are interested in politics.

Professor Canon is really passionate about the material. While attendance is not mandatory, I highly encourage you to go to lecture. For notes print out the outlines ahead of time and fill in on things he talks about to explain these topics. Read the textbook and TED's before lecture. Discussions are heavily based on the TED readings. Amazing class

I loved professor Canon. He was an amazing lecturer and really cares about his students' understanding of the content. He related all of the content to the current time and does a good job of being objective. There is a lot of reading but you only really need the textbook for review, so I would suggest sticking to TED readings.

Truly one of the best professors I've ever had. Lectures can seem dull but if you go to them, you don't need to read the textbook (he literally wrote the book so he just uses that info in class). SUPER straightforward with what you need to know. He's also such a nice guy. definitely take.

Gives great foundation for political science, very applicable in real life. Wrote both of the textbooks, TED is a must read, otherwise lecture covers it. Save time and read chapter outlines that he posts on canvas for textbook. Ask for review sheet early on and take notes on it, all you need to study for exams. TA's helpful! Highly recommend!!

Canon is a great lecturer and attending class really helps you understand the material. Some of the TED readings can be confusing, but because section attendance is mandatory, your TA will help a lot. Canon does a fantastic job conveying the information in lecture and reading the textbook isn't exactl necessary unless you're confused about a topic.

Professor Canon is a great professor who cares deeply about political science and his students. His lectures are boring, yet he is passionate about the topics which makes going not too bad. However, Professor Canon does not hide his political views well. He spends the first half of lecture laughing at the president and sharing one-sided information

Professor Canon was great - his lectures were to the point and taught pretty much exactly what would be on the test. If you stay on top of the readings and attend most of the lectures, the tests will be fairly easy for you. Keep your discussion worksheets, as they're useful to study from, and attend the review sessions before each exam.

I've studied in 4 different countries, and Canon is one of the best professors I've ever had. Great lectures even if you don't know much about politics, and really helpful in office hours too. Exams & the grading in general are fair  tough to get an A though, but possible if you work very hard & show some commitment beyond coursework. He's great.

Ps 104 was way easier than I expected. Canon gives very detailed lecture outlines so you really only have to go to the discussion once a week. He also gives very long and detailed study guides which are very helpful if you do them but they aren't graded. I probably opened the textbook once and got an A so if you study for the exams you'll be fine
Class was very difficult, not easy to get feedback from TA or professor. Wouldnt not take again or recommend to anyone unless you want your GPA to fall.

David Canon is the best professor I have ever had, a very caring professor and is respected deeply by his students. Incredible class would recommend to everyone and is super passionate about his field.
Lectures are drawn out and can be quite boring. But hes a fun teacher and really knows his stuff, and makes it very easy to understand.

Professor Canon inspired me to want to major in Political Science when I had him my first semester Freshman year. I absolutely loved his class - he is very much respected and is a clear, insightful, and intelligent person. The tests are straightforward - not easy, but very fair. Reading is manageable. If you have the chance, take his class!

Don't need to go to lecture, but then expect to read the textbook. If you go to lecture you don't need the textbook but you will need the book required for discussion "The Enduring Debate". Discussion is mandatory and participation is graded. Read the enduring debate and you will be fine for discussion and exams, which are that book and lecture

Dr. Canon was an incredible professor. While American Politics is a very broad subject matter for a one semester class, Canon's lectures always helped clarify information that may have been ambiguous in the reading. He is undoubtedly the smartest professor I have ever learned from. Despite being a difficult class, I would take his course again.
great prof and he picks out great TAs. learned so much!! not an easy class but worth it.

For a political class (especially during the election) he was extremely objective and gave awesome lectures. He was always interesting to listen to and kept the class engaging by incorporating a lot of current events and real life examples. Definitely recommend him and this class.

David Canon is probably one of the best professors I have had at this school! He is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about politics, it's almost impossible to not enjoy his lectures. There is a ton of reading, but most of it is very interesting. The exams are relatively easy as long as you keep up on the readings and attend lectures.

Canon is a fantastic Professor there is really no debate about that. Extremely organized, lectures stay on point and you can tell he's just a good guy. Widely considered one of the better Political Science minds in the Big Ten.

I'm a French student and with this class, I have learned a lot about American Politic and Government. I definitely loved this course ! The textbooks are really interesting, and easy to understand with current examples for each chapter. Mr Canon is very competent and is passionate about political science. He is willing to help his students.

I loved PS104. It's what made me decide to be a Political Science major. There is a ton of reading but much of it is reiterated in lecture. The readings are important for being able to participate in discussion. Take this class as a Comm B if you're a poli sci major. It's the only Comm B within the major and it's fascinating.
He is a wonderful professor who loves to answer questions and help you be successful. His tests are pretty hard.

Canon is a standup guy & great professor! He's very organized, informative, and he  gives out really good study guides. Even though this is a politics class, he keeps it objective, showing no political favoritism. There is a lot of reading, but if you follow the politics, you'll understand most of it beforehand. Make sure you also read TED!

Dr. Canon is a great professor! The class requires a lot of reading which is what a lot of the discussions are based off of, and where a few test questions come from. He's clearly very knowledgable in his field, and great at answering questions and clarifying. Good class for learning about gov. and what's going on in the world!

Go to lecture because he adds a lot of commentary along with the slides that will be ontest. Assigns aa TON of reading. I didn't do it and got an AB, but I'm sure it would help a lot with exams/wouldn't need to go to lecture then maybe. Grade is literally just tests and discussion attendance. Professor is very nice.

Dr. Canon knows what he's talking about and is very thorough and clear in his lectures. He helped write both the books necessary for the class, and it's important to read them and not get behind. He tries to keep lectures interesting, always holds helpful review sessions, and is overall a great guy!
amazing professor, incredibly intelligent and communicates his lectures very clearly and keeps them interesting. everyone at UW should take a course from this man.
Fantastic in lecture. Make sure you do the readings, as general ideas from them are on the exams.
Very organized and informative lectures taught from two textbooks that he has helped write/compile himself. Very fair and clear expectations of students in his class.

Reading from the two textbooks (about 100 pages a week) is essential to getting a good grade. The lecture outlines are posted online, but it doesn't go into the detail that Prof. Canon does in lecture. It's not necessary to come in with vast knowledge of American politics to get a good grade. Great professor overall.
As long as you read the texts you'll be fine. Power points are posted online.

Professor Canon was a good professor. His lectures were long. Although one could very easily get a very high score without attending lecture, there are a few tidbits that are picked up for tests. Must do all the readings. Tests are spelling out on the study guide. Study guides are long though, I recommend making a google doc with others.

Canon is an outstanding professor. Makes the power lecture interesting and knows his stuff. Tough class. Put in the effort and you'll get a good grade. Weekly short writings depending on your TA. 3 exams, with MC and IDs. A lot of reading throughout the course. Study a lot and it will pay off. Don't get behind.

This class has a ton of reading that you're going to want to do all of. The tests are tough, but if you do all of the homework (100 pages of reading a week) and take good notes you will set yourself up for success. Definitely required a ton of effort but you will learn a ton about American government. Highly recommend if you're ready for the work.

I absolutely love Dave! He is very passionate about politics. He is extremely helpful and gives you the coursemidtermfinal expectations in organized review sheets. His lectures are long sometimes, but interesting and relevant. Attend lecture and disscussion, do the readingshomework, study, and you will be fine. Canon also has a great humor!

Professor Canon is extremely helpful. He gives study guides for all tests, they are long, but still helpful. Lots of reading, but if you keep up and study hard for midterms and finals off of the study guide you will be fine. He is actually really funny at times, super nice, helpful, and crazy smart.

Read the textbook and read the extra red one. Lectures are dry and boring, and im a poli sci major. Very knowledgeable. He tells you what you should no for the test and you have a research paper too. My TA was terrible, so dont be afraid to switch sections

I love having Professor Canon for this class. He is very helpful, very knowledgable and you can tell he truly enjoys what he does. His review sessions are very helpful because he lets you ask any questions that you may have about the exam. One of the best professors I've had here, he definitely takes pride in what he does!

If you go to class and take good notes, you will do well. I only skimmed the readings and read the bolded text in the textbook. Memorize terms before the test. The small amount of extra credit there is is only based on lecture material. He is great at lecturing and knows how to make class fascinating. PARTICIPATE IN DISCUSSION.

Professor Canon is extremely knowledgeable in the subject he teaches. He's unbiased and is funny at times, but his power lectures are pretty dry. Exams are fair. For essays, make sure you talk about why the topic is important. Review sessions are extremely helpful, his and the TAs'. I respected Canon more than any professor I've ever had.
All around great professor.  Captivating lecturer.  Wrote one of the books and put together the other one.  Pretty easy if you go to lecture and read.

David was the best professor I have had during my time at Madison. He is very passionate about the material and really wants his students to succeed. Lecture was very interesting and the textbook was extremely well written and easy to read. Overall I recommend this class taught by Prof. Canon to anyone.

Great professor who obviously loves what he does.  Was completely unbiased on issues when discussing the current state of our government even though Madison is a very liberal city.  Nice not to have views pushed on me

I loved this class with Canon. He is very clear and explains things well. There is a ton of reading, but it is not essential to know it in depth, so skimming or reading the abstracts before articles is enough. He also provides a detail review sheet with everything that will be on each test. And no homework besides reading.

He obviously loves what he does, it is hard to not get into class when he is speaking so passionately. Lectures are kind of boring but his attitude makes them so much better. Strongly recommend him, and as long as you understand the study guide exams are not bad at all.
Really interesting guy. I've never been more in touch with modern politics from a class. Lots of reading. Decently hard tests. Do yourself a favor and participate, you'll learn a lot.

Professor is extremely knowledgeable and is clearly passionate about his work. There is a lot of reading in this class--not all of it is necessary, some can definitely be skimmed. Go to class, go to discussion, and try to learn something about American politics from this brilliant man!

Do yourself a favor and don't take this class with Canon. I am an A student and not very interested in politics and had to work my butt off to get a C. Tests and impossible and picky and not curved! Take this with someone else IN THE FALL! GPA RUINED!
A really good guy, very helpful. Even as a poli sci major though, I thought it was pretty dull at times.

Canon is an absolute expert and knows how to teach the material. Lectures aren't the most exciting, but are always organized, clear, and useful. Daily news discussion, loves answering student questions, and extremely friendly during office hours. Midterm and final are MC/short answer/essay and a 10 page paper. One of the best professors out there!

Best Professor by far I have had. Passionate about Poli Sci and really engages the class well for a power lecture. A lot of reading though, so getting an A will require a decent amount of work. Book and lecture are similar, but there's a few things in each not in the other, so look over both.
David Cannon is the definition of a baller and shot caller.  Class should be mandatory for everyone at this university.  His tests aren't easy but fair, study hard and you will get an A.
Lectures are boring.  Reading is about 100 pages a week.  You will do fine in the class if you attend discussion and put up with all of the reading.
DTC while boring knows what he is talking about, even if you hate political science, you will learn a lot in his class.
American Gov isn't the most exciting of topics for many people, but Professor Canon kept it interesting and clear. A lot of reading. Exams are fair (MC and short answer.)

Lectures made topics easier to understand, but would not be necessary if you did the readings.  Tests are not hard as long as you read the books.  I was not interested in poli sci at all before this class, but I enjoyed learning about it with this professor.
He is a badass. I loved him as a prof even though poli sci isn't my thing. Expect to work hard, but it's not impossible.

Nicest man you will ever meet. He's incredibly smart in his field, but knows how to make it clear to people who aren't government experts. He's really helpful during class if you ask questions and is really helpful during office hours. There is a ton of reading, but tests are fairly easy if you read the books.

Overwhelming amount of reading to do, DO NOT PROCRASTINATE!!  Canon gives interesting lectures and is obviously a genius in his field, although power lectures do get boring.  Exams are somewhat difficult, but fair as there is so much material to learn

Canon wrote the textbook and assigns lots of reading. Very passionate and intelligent but 75 minute lectures can be somewhat boring. Good intro to American government, just do the reading and attend class and you'll be fine.
He drinks from the same plastic cup everyday... It makes me thirsty during his boring power lectures
reading intensive, long boring lectures material, was not interesting alot of facts

Canon obviously really likes teaching and the subject he teaches. That said, 75 minute lectures can get long, but still better than most power lectures. He wrote the book, so going to lecture and reading often give you the exact same info, but I think he's very good at relating somewhat hard topics to his audience and the class was fair if u study

Mr. Canon is obviously very passionate about what he does, but his lectures tend to be tedious and dry. His powerpoint slides are muddled and difficult to take notes on/study. You really have to work to draw out the important points.

David Canon was the most excitable professor I've ever had. He loves teaching, getting his students excited about politics, and will answer any question in the middle of lecture. Be prepared for tons of reading, though, but the tests are fair and if you do the work you'll be fine. Don't be afraid to go to office hours.

Great professor. Tons of reading, but you'll do well if you skim the reading and pay close attention in lecture. His textbook is very interesting if you get a chance to read it. He's also very helpful after class and over e-mail. The examples he gives in lecture really help you understand the intricacies of the laws in question.
Extremely knowledgeable about politics. 3 exams, multiple choice and short essays. Read both textbooks and you should do fine.

The class is cool if your into politics, if not it will really be a drag! The lectures are really boring but the discussion sections are helpful and clarify things. Don't take unless needed!! I would not recommend this class to anyone.The professor is a nice guy though and is committed to politics.
